intro: Adicea arguta, commonly known as the slender palaquium, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, smooth fruits that are typically yellow when ripe. Adicea arguta is often found in lowland rainforests and is adapted to humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
